content.definition: An angioplasty balloon coated with an antiproliferative drug (typically paclitaxel 2-3 μg/mm²) that is transferred to the vessel wall during inflation, inhibiting neointimal hyperplasia without leaving a permanent implant. DCBs represent a 'leave nothing behind' philosophy for treating in-stent restenosis and femoropopliteal disease.

evidence: IN.PACT Admiral: superior patency in femoropopliteal

clinical_pearls: Optimal for in-stent restenosis where repeat stenting fails
Pre-dilatation mandatory to ensure drug transfer
Paclitaxel safety signal debated but currently FDA approved
Drug-eluting stent still preferred for very long lesions
